nodes.text: Farsellah was a terrestrial world located in the Farsellah system, a part of the Farstey sector in the Trans-Hydian portion of the Expansion Region.

By 7 ABY, the Galactic Empire informant Rodin Baem was sighted on many worlds, most of which were controlled by the New Republic. Those worlds included Farsellah, and in a personal addendum to an entry on Baem included in the datafile Wanted by Cracken, New Republic General Airen Cracken noted that Baem's appearance on those worlds potentially signaled that the Empire would soon attack them, and that the respective star systems should make appropriate preparations.

Farsellah was mentioned in the 1993 sourcebook Wanted by Cracken, which was written by Louis J. Prosperi for West End Games' Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game. The 2009 reference book The Essential Atlas placed the Farsellah system, and therefore the world Farsellah, in grid square O-8.
